Mechanical and Electrical Engineer Job at Tasty Time Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Tasty Time Nigeria Limited (www.tastytimedrinks.com.ng) is a food and beverage production and processing company based in Ipaja, Alimosho, Lagos State.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mechanical and Electrical Engineer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Resolve all mechanical maintenance issues on the company machineries and recommend improvement if required
	Ensure all downtimes are eliminated or reduced
	Assembling, evaluating, testing and maintaining electrical or mechanical equipments machineries
	Constructing and fabricating parts, using hand tools and specifications
	Reading and interpreting mechatronic circuit blueprints, diagram and schematics
	Supervising machine operators
	Installing and performing diagnostics tests on mechanic systems
	Training co-workers on the safe and adhering to industry regulations.
	Maintain an efficient and safe working environment for all employees.
	Helping to develop and implement electrical and mechanical maintenance plans to prevent costly equipment breakdown.
	Documenting machines fault for proper preventive maintenances and keeping maintainance or services records
	Optimizing electrical efficiency by adjusting machinery and equipment settings
	Undertaking any other reasonable tasks as required
	Resolve all maintenance issues and recommend improvements to same if required.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND with 8 years of experience. 


Salary
N200,000 / month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@tastytimedrinks.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

	Strong knowledge of project lifecycle and performance metrics.
	Understanding of project controls, budgeting, scheduling, and reporting standards.

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Project Analyst Specialist provides advanced analytical support to the project management team by collecting and interpreting complex data, identifying trends, monitoring performance, and contributing to strategic decision-making.
	This role ensures project objectives are met efficiently by proactively tracking progress, risks, and deliverables, and by driving process improvements across all project phases.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Project Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in a project support or analyst role, preferably in oil & gas or engineering services.
	Proficient in project management tools and software (e.g., MS Project, Primavera P6, Excel, Power BI).
	Strong knowledge of project lifecycle and performance metrics.
	Understanding of project controls, budgeting, scheduling, and reporting standards.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of their resume to: recruitment@seflamsgl.com and stakeholder.recruitment@ncdmb.gov.ng using the Job Position as subject of the mail.

	Chief Engineer Certificate of Competency (capacity dependent on tonnage of vessel)

Chief Engineer Job at Bourbon Interoil Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Bourbon Interoil Nigeria Limited, as leading international player in marine services, offers to the most demanding oil & gas clients worldwide a full line of innovative, safe, high performance and new generation vessels and an expanded offer of offshore oil & gas services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Engineer
Job Location: Onne base, Rivers

Job Summary


	The Chief Engineer is directly responsible and accountable to the Master for the supervision and management of all technical and related departments on-board.


Roles
     

            
    




	Shall provide reliable operation of the vessel’s engines, machinery and all other mechanical equipment.
	Has whatever authority the Master delegates upon him/her with regard to the Technical Departments on-board and the crew members assigned to work therein.
	Shall support the Master by carrying out any legal orders and/or instructions issued by the Master when such orders and/or instructions are sound and within the accepted practices of good seamanship.
	May supervise or delegate responsible supervision to another engineering officer for any ‘hot work’ performed on-board.
	Apply, follow and encourage Company policy and procedures in the performance of all tasks, with special emphasis on the protection of the environment and pollution prevention.
	Shall ensure that Company policy and procedure is rigorously maintained with all technical and engineering related job and task planning, with special emphasis on the correct use and application of PPE, safety equipment, Risk Assessment, JSA use, Checklists, Pre-task “tool box talks” and all other safety precautions relating to job and task performance.
	Shall plan and supervise technical and engineering related operations including the corrective and preventive maintenance and inspection of the vessel’s equipment, machinery and associated plants in accordance with all safe working practices and with regard to the Master’s orders.
	Additional Duties include but not limited to: Any other duties as assigned by the technical manager or his designate.


Qualifications, Skills and Experiences


	Chief Engineer Certificate of Competency (capacity dependent on tonnage of vessel)
	Proven, verifiable working experience on-board a Supply Vessel as a Chief Engineer or 2nd Engineer
	Possession of all required STCW Certificates and Mandatories.
